p: Large oligomers of αSyn preferentially bind to the SNARE protein synaptobrevin-2 and inhibit SNARE complex formation, thus impeding vesicle docking and neurotransmitter release [ 135]. Small diffused granular αSyn aggregates were enormously detected in the presynaptic terminals of neurons in DLB brain tissues along with significant loss of postsynaptic dendritic spines, suggesting the role of such granular αSyn aggregates in synaptic dysfunction [ 136].
